isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING COMPRESSOR AND CLUTCH TWO CYLINDER RECIPROCATING TYPE - BEFORE 01/01/1993 (R-12) - REMOVE AND INSTALL - CLUTCH ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Using a spanner wrench or other means to secure the clutch pulley, remove retainer bolt ( Figure 11).

figure.caption: Figure 11. Removing Clutch Assembly From Compressor

step1.para: Install a clutch remover bolt into threaded clutch drive hub and tighten. The pressure of the bolt end against the compressor crankshaft will force the drive hub loose.
Remove clutch pulley assembly from compressor crankshaft. Remove the key from the crankshaft.
Remove capscrews and detach the stationary field coil.
Install stationary field coil on the compressor and tighten the capscrews finger tight.
Install the key on the crankshaft.
Place the drive clutch on the shaft. Secure clutch to shaft with a new Nylok grade 5 hex head bolt. Tighten to 20 to 25 ft-lbs. (27 to 34 N•m).

caution.para: Always use a new Nylok retaining bolt to attach the clutch to the crankshaft. The nylon insert is designed to maintain proper torque on the first application only.

step1.para: Turn the pulley by hand to determine any interference between the field coil and the pulley. If there is interference, a rubbing noise will be heard as the pulley is rotated. Adjust the position of the coil until no rubbing is heard. Tighten to 7 to 10 ft-lbs. (9 to 14 N•m).
